intro: Pentaraphia scabra, commonly known as the roughleaf sandmat, is a flowering plant native to arid and semi-arid regions of southern Africa. It belongs to the family Amaranthaceae and is characterized by its rough, hairy stems and leaves. The plant produces small, greenish-yellow flowers that are clustered in dense inflorescences. It is well adapted to dry environments, with a deep root system that allows it to survive in poor soils. Pentaraphia scabra is often found in rocky areas and sandy soils, thriving in regions with low rainfall.
